page.title: 01COTSWOLD ESCARPMENT:HORTON
page.content: Block 0376013 is situated on the Cotswold escarpment 18km N of Bath.It is an agricultural area.The small residential section consists of the older part of the village of Horton, recorded in the original Domesday Book. Many of the residents are employed in agricultural work but others commute to Bristol,Bath and further afield.The fringes of the block are in the adjoining parishes of Hawkesbury, Badminton and Little Sodbury.The A46 leads from Stroud to Bath through the centre of the block. Holiday and commercial traffic hurries through to join the M4 Motorway,its occupants unaware of the variety of life in the apparently quiet fields around.Some tourists pause however to stay at the Petty France Hotel or to tread the Cotswold Way and enjoy our rural delights. D.G.Cooksley
